measured_by: simple categorisation task with ellipse or Gabor orientations
justification: The paper introduces “the simple categorisation task” in which participants decide whether an oriented stimulus belongs to a narrow or wide distribution, using it as the empirical testbed for models of perceptual categorization.

measured_by: collinearity judgements task with two peripheral line segments
justification: In describing empirical tests, the authors state: “In this task, participants were asked to judge whether two peripherally presented line segments… were collinear,” treating this paradigm as the measure of collinearity judgment.

measured_by: visual search task using briefly presented Gabor arrays
justification: The article evaluates models on a visual search experiment where “participants were asked to report the presence or absence of a target Gabor patch…,” using this task as the instrument for assessing visual search performance.

measured_by: outlier classification task with four Gabor stimuli
justification: The authors test models with the ‘outlier classification task’ in which observers identify the differently oriented Gabor, employing this paradigm to measure outlier orientation classification behaviour.

measured_by: change detection task with oriented ellipses across a delay
justification: For working-memory inference, the paper analyses data from a task where “participants viewed four oriented ellipses… then indicated whether one ellipse changed orientation,” using this as the measure of change-detection ability in working memory.
